sentence.text: The search for clinically relevant molecular markers in classical Hodgkin lymphoma (eye development) is hampered by the histopathological complexity of the disease, resulting from the admixture of a small number of neoplastic Hodgkin and Reed-Sternberg (H-regulation of transcription, DNA-templated) cells with an abundant and heterogeneous microenvironment.
We reinforce the potential of proteolysis as an interesting target to be explored in adult and pediatric cHL, and alert for its dual biological role in H-RS cells and tumor microenvironment
